justification: The article states, “For example, Positive Affect (PCIRS) is described as ‘the degree to which mothers verbally and non-verbally expressed positive regard…,’” explicitly linking the construct Positive Affect to the PCIRS instrument.

In the Warmth section the authors note that “the constructs Warmth (MBRS)…rate ‘both the overt behaviour of the parent and the quality of fondness conveyed’,” identifying Warmth as a construct assessed with the MBRS.

The text explains that Sensitivity is “mentioned explicitly for the constructs … Sensitivity (EAS), whose descriptions mention … ‘genuine, authentic, and congruent interest’,” showing Sensitivity is operationalised with the EAS.
Under Responsiveness the review states, “the CARP-A and MACI … use the construct Sensitive Responsiveness,” linking this construct to the MACI coding system.

justification: The same sentence notes that “the CARP-A and MACI … use the construct Sensitive Responsiveness,” indicating CARP-A also measures this construct.

justification: In the Dyadic category the construct list includes “Dyadic Mutuality, CARP-A,” indicating this dyadic coordination construct is measured with CARP-A.
